content: Every penny spent and every minute spent in Minnesota, Virginia, New Jersey or any waste of another place, is another dollar not spent in the critical swing states of PA, MI and WI, Bidens exact path to 270 if he carries those 3. Omaha and MN will be running left of MI, WI and PA. VA and MN is about making Dems play defense like Biden making Trump need to play defense in FL and NC.The election will come down to if Biden can take all of PA, MI and WI. If you like what the polls say, then you'll need to acknowledge the current aggregates of MI and WI on 538 and HQ the Hill which are both with or without RFK included a half percent to one percent in Trump's favorite.It really is not a comfortable lead. That is classic margin of error. Even PA is in the margin of error. I get that a lot of Trump's money is being spent on legal fees. But why focus so much resources cutting in to territory that is more blue traditionally if there are purple stays he isn't yet out of the margin of error on? Seems counterintuitive. And all the GOP has been doing since the '16 election is losing so I'm not exactly seeing the results in these strategies.

content: Every penny spent and every minute spent in Minnesota, Virginia, New Jersey or any waste of another place, is another dollar not spent in the critical swing states of PA, MI and WI, Bidens exact path to 270 if he carries those 3. Omaha and MN will be running left of MI, WI and PA. VA and MN is about making Dems play defense like Biden making Trump need to play defense in FL and NC.The election will come down to if Biden can take all of PA, MI and WI. If you like what the polls say, then you'll need to acknowledge the current aggregates of MI and WI on 538 and HQ the Hill which are both with or without RFK included a half percent to one percent in Trump's favorite.It really is not a comfortable lead. That is classic margin of error. Even PA is in the margin of error. I get that a lot of Trump's money is being spent on legal fees. But why focus so much resources cutting in to territory that is more blue traditionally if there are purple stays he isn't yet out of the margin of error on? Seems counterintuitive. And all the GOP has been doing since the '16 election is losing so I'm not exactly seeing the results in these strategies.

author: Steve Hatter

content:
Greetings all DNom refugees! 👋 There's been a lot of information to sort through before deciding who to bet on, so consider the following evidence to guide your thinking:1. Trump wants a VP "that can do a fantastic job as president, because you always have to think of that first—and second, somebody that helps you get elected, and there's nothing wrong with that." (7/8) 


View


 Hide




2. Washington Post: "They are ideally Black or a woman, though that’s not required. And they are most certainly not taller than Trump himself. [...] He does not necessarily want a successor as the leader of the MAGA movement; he would prefer that the Republican Party duke it out for his endorsement in four years, one adviser said. He wants a No. 2 who has won in the past. [...] But more than anything, he wants someone who can help him win." (4/12) https://www.washingtonpost....3. Despite wanting a VP that helps him get elected, he thinks the choice "never really had that much of an effect on an election." Meaning the VP would help him in other ways than swinging votes. (1/31) https://www.wunc.org/2024-0...4. Some of the potential VPs Trump took an interest in organically (ie. they weren't in the news for anything) included Tom Cotton, Bill Hagerty, and Mike Lee. Trump said Lee was on the list because he "loved Lee's haircut." (5/5) https://www.axios.com/2024/...5. When Trump looks at potential VPs on TV, he "repeatedly asks 'Where is my Cary Grant?'" Implying that he sees the way the VP can 'help' is by looking like a 1960s clean-cut actor on TV defending him - like Cotton, Hagerty, or Lee. (4/12) https://www.washingtonpost....6. Trump elaborates on what he means by Cary Grant: "Do you remember Cary Grant? How good was he, right? I don't know what happened to movie stars today. We used to have Cary Grant, Clark Gable, and today -- I will not say names because we don't need enemies. I get enough enemies. Cary Grant was like Michael Jackson once told me, the most handsome man in the world, Cary Grant, and we don't have that anymore. The Cary Grant at 81 or 82, going on 100, this guy, he is 81 going on 100, Cary Grant would not look too good in a bathing suit either, and he was pretty good-looking, right?" (3/9) https://www.c-span.org/vide...7. Trump told 2016 runner-up Chris Christie he picked Pence because "you've got to admit, he's straight out of central casting." https://www.afr.com/world/n...8. NY Post: Trump wants a VP with "good hair" (6/15) https://nypost.com/2024/06/...9. AP: Trump thinks Burgum is "central casting" (6/24) https://apnews.com/article/...10. WSJ: Burgum is on the list because he's "good looking" (5/18) https://www.wsj.com/politic...When we look back on this, all the evidence will have been pointing in the same direction.

content: Several of the candidates have clear downsides. Rubio and DeSantis would draw the same base of home-state voters as Trump, as they’re all from Florida, something Rubio mentioned when asked by Fox News in January about the prospect of joining Trump’s ticket. Stefanik represents a solidly blue state that Trump almost certainly can’t win. And Scott broke with Trump’s GOP allies in Congress and voted to certify the results of the 2020 presidential election. Vance was also critical of Trump when he ran in 2016, publicly blasting him for his anti-immigrant and anti-Muslim policies and rhetoric.https://www.forbes.com/site...

content: "We can debate whether the jab actually lessened the effect of the virus or whether it killed anyone"  we can, but the evidence is overwhelming that it saved hundreds of thousands of lives. I am happy to provide links / charts to backup my assertions: e.g. covid deaths by age group lower in vaccinated population https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/vo...  or https://www.scientificameri...  Don't trust the death reports to accurately track who "died of covid?" fine. how about just counting bodies?  All cause death rates per 100,000 people were about twice as high in the 10 states with the lowest vaccination rates vs the 10 with the highest. https://jamanetwork.com/jou...  <= From June 2021 to March 2022, the 10 least vaccinated states would have avoided 120k deaths labelled as covid and over 265k deaths in total had they had vaccination rates similar to the 10 most vaccinated states during that period.Now: "But the narrative from our corrupt government (which you can find online from hundreds of people including Biden*) was that you would be inoculated"  during an unscripted townhall Biden did say "You’re not going to get COVID if you have these vaccinations," and "If you’re vaccinated, you’re not going to be hospitalized, you’re not going to be in the ICU unit, and you’re not going to die."  however in that same public appearance, Biden also stated, accurately, that vaccinated people are less likely to catch the virus than unvaccinated people and, if they do catch it, are less likely to get sick.  So. you caught a politician oversimplifying exaggerating.   So?  the CDC didn't say that. Fauci didn't say that: https://www.reuters.com/art...

content: Donald Trump’s perfect vice president looks the part: attractive and telegenic. They are ideally Black or a woman, though that’s not required. And they are most certainly not taller than Trump himself.Trump wants someone he sees in person but doesn’t see too much, his advisers say. He does not necessarily want a successor as the leader of the MAGA movement; he would prefer that the Republican Party duke it out for his endorsement in four years, one adviser said. He wants a No. 2 who has won in the past. And he wants someone who will never contradict his false claims about the outcome of the 2020 election.But more than anything, he wants someone who can help him win. https://www.washingtonpost....
author: int201

content: He watches TV and judges potential candidates carefully — not only what they say, but also their body language and whether they seem confident and convincing.“Where is my Cary Grant?” Trump repeatedly asks.Most voters already have strong views about Trump, and he has suggested that his choice of running mate “won’t have any impact at all.”A knock against Lake, who is running for a U.S. Senate seat in Arizona, is that she did not win her 2022 gubernatorial race, according to three Trump advisers. [Hint: Zeldin buyers]“I think he’s genuinely conflicted on several ideas,” Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) said. “He’ll mention a few names, but he’s more thinking about: Can you be president, and can you help me.”

content: The obvious meaning of helping Trump get elected is someone who will help him in the swing states or with a key swing demographic,  so a midwesterner, woman, black, or Hispanic. But another way to look at it is someone who can help him come up with the best way to approach a problem. For example, how to talk about abortion in a way that doesn't alienate swing voters. This person would need to be someone Trump respects and listens to, and most likely he's already shown signs of taking their advice in how they talk about abortion.

content: Trump can't win with a massively anti-abortion candidate.  His own just-released platform backs away from any type of national abortion plan and does NOT define marriage as only between a man and a woman.  Trump is back to being Trump -- a former Democrat who switched parties to become president and is pretty much a Libertarian with his policies (except that he LOVES government spending because he's rich and already has his money and inflation doesn't hurt him).So where do his VP contenders stand on abortion?Dougie:  Far too strict!JayDee:Super pro-life in the past, but has toned it down, but not enough.Marco: Says he'd like no abortions, not even for rape, incest, or human trafficking (2022).Bennie: He never even talks about policies, but he's too pro-life.Timbo: Religiously pro-life.Vivek: Claims to be super pro-life, but wants to wipe out all the Black and Hispanic babies, unless he can get them to work in his factories.Tulsi: Moderate.Nikki: Pro-life but clearly made the case that it's up to a woman and her doctor during her campaigning.Elise: Too pro-life because she wants to please the base.Only Tulsi and Nikki fit what many moderate women are seeking with respect to this issue.

Vance is the future of the Republican Party,” said Rep. content: Honestly, I doubt it. His ego does matter to him more than you realize. He believes the media will be on that one and mock him for it. When you operate as a showman with not much actual results, it doesn't help. Think about this. What good did it do Trump or the GOP whining for years about election fraud mumbo jumbo? The GOP has not done well in all elections since 2016. They have underperformed especially against polls since Trump left office. Dobbs is part of that but too much association to Trump and his talking points is part of it too.Trump has loss a lot of touch on what actually matters to the middle. Without delivering later on, in the '16 election, he at least highlighted what the issues were.He is completely misreading and miscommunication to black voters. He recently said "black jobs" in reference to undocumented immigrants. Implying black folks are all a bunch of peasants working off the books jobs. That didn't go over well and it's eroding any gains he made with them, that never seem to hold in any election.Trump also recently communicated to black male voters wanting to bring back stop and frisk. Despite him not clicking that's who was targeted the most during it. How are saying these things going to prevent him from going to prison?Who Trump picks as a potential VP candidate is not going to matter much. If Trump picks Rubio, it helps most in AZ and NV. If Trump can't get the blue wall from MI, WI, PA, NE 02 or MN, he will lose. The Latino population is smaller in those states.I don't see how JD Vance helps him having been an election denier who is see too far to the right. Plus relatively inexperienced. Burgum could be a solid pick to come off as reasonable to Midwestern and rustbelt older white voters he is likely to split Biden with. He gives the Haley votes a feel for the pre Trump GOP. He has shown empathy to others in the past. A trait Trump does not have.I don't think Scott or Carson adds much black votes at all. Despite many MAGA wanting to believe so.Why do you see undecided voters in MI, WI and PA, Biden's potential path to 270, as strongest with Rubio?Trump doesn't like anyone taking his spotlight. Not now. Not in 2028. Rubio has presidential aspirations. He is relatively young. He has shown he can stand up to Trump a little bit if when needed even if he weasels out. Trump wants someone who won't run or at least not in 2028. Assuming Trump were to win this time.

Rubio is Cuban; he does well with the Florida Hispanic community which is mostly Cuban and Puerto Rican--but Hispanics in places like AZ, NV, etc are mostly Mexicans and Central Americans—they have nothing in common with him. I know this might seem hard to believe, but there's big cultural differences there. Even the way they speak Spanish is different.At any rate, Florida is already solidly red so any Hispanic boost there doesn't matter; as for the other states, I don't think the potential is as big as you might think. content: It's an interesting poll 20 percent more likely to vote for Trump if Rubio, 16% if Vance, but I'd have to ask how valuable this information really is. Remember, they surveyed registered GOP voters as well as independents. Those GOP voters, regardless of what they say, are not going to sit the race out, no matter who the VP is. As for the independents, well--you'd have to take a hard look at the numbers and sampling methods and decide if you really think that small difference +/- margin of error is worthwhile. Me, I'd take that risk.

author: david84871

content: Here is why I believe Trump should and will pick Tulsi Gabbard as VP - and that this has been planned for several years.-Tulsi Gabbard was sent on a mission by Trump and Steve Bannon in 2016 after he was elected. She went to Syria and met with Assad. The meeting with Trump was for optics to begin preparing people for her. The mission was something they wanted to see if she could do - which she completed.-She also ran for president in 2020, so she could practice on the debate stage and run a campaign. Part of the plan.-She had a mission given to her by Trump's team, which was to make Kamala Harris look terrible during the debate, which she did and completed. Another preparation for four years later.-Remember, she did not vote to impeach Trump. Remember, this has been planned years ago. It would've been too difficult for her to defend the position of impeaching Trump years later to be on his ticket. She took a lot of heat for not voting to impeach him. Remember, when that decision was made, they knew she was going to VP. It was a political decision.-She spoke at CPAC. Another step in her preparing her for VP. I mean, the woman f’ing vote spoke at CPAC! You really don't think they're planning on having her in Trumps administration at the very least?-“But she endorsed Biden!" Exactly. So she can validate the people who have the arc where they came from supporting Biden, but realized Trump is better. That's very important. Do not assume that everybody always had to be the same as you.-She left the Democrat party two years ago and did not run for reelection. Why? Because she couldn't go from Democrat congresswoman to GOP VP. That would've been too extreme. The plan was always for her to leave the party, spend two years preparing for this, and then have the time in between so she can transition into a politician on a Republican ticket. Note that I did not say she's necessarily even a republican.You're worried because she was on the list of the WEF or CFR? So am I. But it's impossible to find someone in DC who doesn't have something a bit questionable. She's done nothing the last 8 or 9 years to cause concern.-It's not about what you want. It's about what other Americans want that don't completely agree with you, but will share the country with you.-Destroying the Democratic Party is the number one objective. Not uniting the GOP. Trump hates the GOP. Tulsi Gabbard is the one that will bring the most people together from outside the GOP.-Look at her recent positions, such as calling for the deportation of all illegals. She's gearing up to join Trump on the ticket with these positions.-“Trump should pick a black guy like Tim Scott or Ben Carson to get the black vote!” That would be a great way in my opinion to lose the black vote. Trump is already blacker than those two and I’m not going to support pandering to a group of people based on their skin color. If Trump wants people in the black community to support him he’ll work with musicians and sports people who probably have more impact than some politician.-That being said(!), Trump picking a woman, especially one in her early 40s with no children, would drive the extreme leftist women insane. This would be funny. But also bring women to the ticket where he is lacking greatly.-Her military background is very notable, very admirable, and very legitimate. Remember, what did the Q drops consistently talk about – the military. She has been very consistent in her loyalty to the military, whether you like it or not. Whether you're worried she's a snake or not. That loyalty to the military is very important to this entire situation. Has Vivek or Ben Carson or any of these other people (with the exception of Mike Flynn – credit for that obviously) served in the military? Come on Q people, all you patriots and Q people and maga people who want Ben Carson and Vivek and these people for VP? Where is their military service? Where is it? That is very very important - and for a woman to have that background and having done that is unique and attractive.-Speaking of attractive, she is attractive. Not to be underestimated. And we know looks are important to Trump!-Lastly, and this is the most important policy for me: she is very very anti-war, especially anti-stupid war. We have killed millions of people by stupid wars in the last 30 to 40 years. And many more before that that are maybe not as relevant as our current foreign policy. She has always been against that. Consistently.-Let me reiterate, and this is the most important point. This is not about picking somebody who agrees with everything you say. This is not about somebody that you support completely. It's about somebody that will bring unity to the country. Trump is a dealmaker. He is first and foremost, a dealmaker. A good deal maker recognizes that you don't always get everything exactly as you want in a deal. But everybody should walk away with something and be fairly happy. That is what the art of the deal is all about.-Trump doesn't want to unite the GOP. He wants to unite the country. Ben Carson, Michael f'ing Flynn, Vivek Ramaswami, the rest of these idiot GOP governors - they are not going to unite the country. They are not going to bring people together, who are in the sort of classical liberal left like Glenn Greenwald or Tiabbi or Aaron Mate or Jimmy Dore - reasonable Americans, who may not agree with everything you want, but are definite worth working with. Those are the people they are going to be politically homeless and be frustrated if Trump picks somebody like this Dakota governor. Trump is smart. He knows how to make a deal. I think he's going to be Tulsi Gabbard because she is the one that will best bring people together.

While his campaign said that Trump’s comments will focus on President Biden’s policies — including the high cost of living in Republican-dominated Florida — the rally is likely to fuel speculation over his choice of running mate. U.S. Sen. Marco Rubio, a Miami native, is seen as a top contender for the Republican vice presidential slot.

content: Fact check GPT but I think that these were the last two people to not be senators or governors who were VPs.Garret Hobart (1897-1899) - He was a lawyer and businessman from New Jersey before becoming Vice President under William McKinley.Charles W. Fairbanks (1905-1909) - Fairbanks was a lawyer and served in various political positions in Indiana before becoming Vice President under Theodore Roosevelt.
author: chris94959

content: Sorry Chris94959, but you are wrong. James Sherman (1909-1912) , not a Governor or a Senator, was Taft's VP, even though he had only been a Representative from New York. Charles Dawes (1925-1929), Coolidge's VP, was not a Governor or a Senator, but he was Ambassador to Great Britain and Budget Director. John Nance Garner (1933-1941), FDRs first VP, was not a Governor or a Senator, but he was Speaker of the House. Henry W'allace (1941-1945), FDR's second VP, was not a Governor or a Senator, but was Secretary of Agriculture. Gerald Ford (1973-1974) was not a Governor or a Senator, but was House Minority Leader (admittedly an unusual case), George H.W. Bush (1981-1989), Reagan's VP, was not a Governor or Senator, but was CIA Director and UN Ambassador.  Dick Cheney (2001-2009), George W Bush's VP, was not a Governor or a Senator, but was Secretary of Defense.
author: mnjimmy

content: This is a great list thank you!!! Explains why random house member without any former experience with the administration wouldn't be qualified by historical standards.

author: mnjimmy

content: -Tulsi Gabbard was sent on a mission by Trump and Steve Bannon in 2016 after he was elected. She went to Syria and met with Assad. The meeting with Trump was for optics to begin preparing people for her. The mission was something they wanted to see if she could do - which she completed.-She also ran for president in 2020, so she could practice on the debate stage and run a campaign. Part of the plan.-She had a mission given to her by Trump's team, which was to make Kamala Harris look terrible during the debate, which she did and completed. Another preparation for four years later.-Remember, she did not vote to impeach Trump. Remember, this has been planned years ago. It would've been too difficult for her to defend the position of impeaching Trump years later to be on his ticket. She took a lot of heat for not voting to impeach him. Remember, when that decision was made, they knew she was going to VP. It was a political decision.-She spoke at CPAC. Another step in her preparing her for VP. I mean, the woman f’ing vote spoke at CPAC! You really don't think they're planning on having her in Trumps administration at the very least?-“But she endorsed Biden!" Exactly. So she can validate the people who have the arc where they came from supporting Biden, but realized Trump is better. That's very important. Do not assume that everybody always had to be the same as you.-She left the Democrat party two years ago and did not run for reelection. Why? Because she couldn't go from Democrat congresswoman to GOP VP. That would've been too extreme. The plan was always for her to leave the party, spend two years preparing for this, and then have the time in between so she can transition into a politician on a Republican ticket. Note that I did not say she's necessarily even a republican.-You're worried because she was on the list of the WEF or CFR? So am I. But it's impossible to find someone in DC who doesn't have something a bit questionable. She's done nothing the last 8 or 9 years to cause concern.-It's not about what you want. It's about what other Americans want that don't completely agree with you, but will share the country with you.-Destroying the Democratic Party is the number one objective. Not uniting the GOP. Trump hates the GOP. Tulsi Gabbard is the one that will bring the most people together from outside the GOP.-Look at her recent positions, such as calling for the deportation of all illegals. She's gearing up to join Trump on the ticket with these positions.-“Trump should pick a black guy like Tim Scott or Ben Carson to get the black vote!” That would be a great way in my opinion to lose the black vote. Trump is already blacker than those two and I’m not going to support pandering to a group of people based on their skin color. If Trump wants people in the black community to support him he’ll work with musicians and sports people who probably have more impact than some politician.-That being said(!), Trump picking a woman, especially one in her early 40s with no children, would drive the extreme leftist women insane. This would be funny. But also bring women to the ticket where he is lacking greatly.-Her military background is very notable, very admirable, and very legitimate. Remember, what did the Q drops consistently talk about – the military. She has been very consistent in her loyalty to the military, whether you like it or not. Whether you're worried she's a snake or not. That loyalty to the military is very important to this entire situation. Has Vivek or Ben Carson or any of these other people (with the exception of Mike Flynn – credit for that obviously) served in the military? Come on Q people, all you patriots and Q people and maga people who want Ben Carson and Vivek and these people for VP? Where is their military service? Where is it? That is very very important - and for a woman to have that background and having done that is unique and attractive.-Speaking of attractive, she is attractive. Not to be underestimated. And we know looks are important to Trump-Lastly, and this is the most important policy for me: she is very very anti-war, especially anti-stupid war. We have killed millions of people by stupid wars in the last 30 to 40 years. And many more before that that are maybe not as relevant as our current foreign policy. She has always been against that. Consistently.
